author: hÃ¤rjaren longsock

text: Whatever, my point is that Laura Shigihara is a great composer who released a 29 song OST for just $4. She could have easily capitalized on the game's success and charged double or triple that, but she instead chose to be really generous. Anyone who chooses not to pay for a soundtrack like that is an asshole.
author: TargetHippo

text: They might only intend to give people who own the product an alternate way of using it. For example, someone who own's a physical copy of a movie may also want to have a copy of it on their computer. In that case downloading the torrent would be legal. I also think that that's why posting torrents is legal.
author: TargetHippo

text: Boy, this game has been so successful since the day it launched. Popcap did great in the music as well as the gameplay
author: Chateau 829

text:
That's like saying that it's OK to shoot someone because you didn't make or sell the gun. If you're choosing not to pay then YOU'RE the reason why the composer isn't getting the money they deserve.
Besides, someone has to buy the product in order to make a torrent of it.
